intro: Gossypianthus martiana, commonly known as the Natal carnation, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Gossypianthus martiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
